all_text_timv: Study of CP Symmetry Violation in the Charmonium-K*(892) Channel By a Complete Time Dependent Angular Analysis (BaBar Experiment) [electronic resource]. Washington, D.C. : United States. Dept. of Energy, 2006. Oak Ridge, Tenn. : Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy. 260 pages : digital, PDF file. text txt rdacontent computer c rdamedia online resource cr rdacarrier Published through SciTech Connect. 09/18/2006. "slac-r-836" T'Jampens, Stephane. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star This thesis presents the full-angular time-dependent analysis of the vector-vector channel B{sub d}° → J/ψ(K{sub S}°π°)*°. After a review of the CP violation in the B meson system, the phenomenology of the charmonium-K*(892) channels is exposed. The method for the measurement of the transversity amplitudes of the B → J/ψK*(892), based on a pseudo-likelihood method, is then exposed. The results from a 81.9 fb⁻¹ of collected data by the BABAR detector at the Υ(4S) resonance peak are  ₀ {sub ∥} {sub ⊥} AC02-76SF00515 Physics Of Elementary Particles And Fields. edbsc Amplitudes. notes_summary_ssim: This thesis presents the full-angular time-dependent analysis of the vector-vector channel B{sub d}° → J/ψ(K{sub S}°π°)*°. After a review of the CP violation in the B meson system, the phenomenology of the charmonium-K*(892) channels is exposed. The method for the measurement of the transversity amplitudes of the B → J/ψK*(892), based on a pseudo-likelihood method, is then exposed. The results from a 81.9 fb⁻¹ of collected data by the BABAR detector at the Υ(4S) resonance peak are  ₀ {sub ∥} {sub ⊥}
